channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Crypto is getting punched in the face again—but this is no 2022
item.description: Bitcoin nearly fell below $80,000 and it could get worse. But the fundamentals are different this time.

item.title: Jimmy Cliff, Reggae Icon, Dies at 81
item.description: The Grammy Award-winning singer and star of the movie “The Harder They Come” died of pneumonia, his wife said.

item.title: F1 has thrived by democratizing what was once a ‘look, don’t touch’ sport, says McLaren Racing CEO Zak Brown
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: I chatted to Ray Dalio’s AI doppelgänger: It claims there’s a 75% chance the AI bubble bursts in 2026, isn’t so worried about national debt—and wouldn’t say which stocks to avoid
item.description: "One thing I’ve learned over the years," the freshly-launched bot muses, "Is that rapid, debt-financed build-outs often precede sharp adjustments.

item.title: Suddenly, the Fed interest rate cut in December looks like it is very much back on the table
item.description: Last week, Wall Street seemed to have decided that a December cut was off the table. Today, speculators put the probability of Fed Chairman Jerome Pow...

item.title: Why Are Guards Using Force More Often in New York’s Prisons?
item.description: State prison guards say they are doing so because their jobs have become more dangerous. A New York Times analysis points to a different reality.

item.title: Dharmendra, Bollywood Leading Man, Dies at 89
item.description: In a career spanning nearly seven decades and more than 300 productions, the actor became one of India’s best known and most versatile screen stars.

item.title: How One German Toymaker Made Money Despite U.S. Tariffs
item.description: A combination of strategic planning, good timing and a long-awaited product helped the maker of electronic story boxes weather the onset of tariffs.

item.title: His Right Foot: One Tiny Drawing for Sale, Maybe by Michelangelo
item.description: The Renaissance artist painted more than 100 figures in the Sistine Chapel ceiling, yet studies for only a handful remain. Could this five-inch drawin...

item.title: Why 90% of decisions don’t reach this Land O’Lakes exec’s desk
item.description: Land O’Lakes’ Leah Anderson avoids the trap of endless analysis by asking one question: Will more information change the outcome or just make you feel...

item.title: Dharmendra, Bollywood Leading Man, Dies at 89
item.description: In a career spanning nearly seven decades and more than 300 productions, the actor became one of India’s best known and most versatile screen stars.

item.title: Who Chanel and Louis Vuitton Have Called When Making Woven Leather Bags
item.description: As Craig Wright has built his brand, Dragon Diffusion, he has quietly built a reputation as a leather whisperer for Hermès, Chanel and others. Now he’...

item.title: Images From Vietnam’s Year of Deadly Wet Weather
item.description: Scientists suggested that climate change could make central Vietnam a global hot spot for destructive storms. This year has seemed to prove the point.

item.title: Russian Disinformation Comes to Mexico, Seeking to Rupture US Ties
item.description: A U.S. government cable said that Kremlin-run outlets had scaled up their efforts across Latin America, seeking to turn people against the United Stat...

item.title: U.S. and Ukraine Hail ‘Meaningful Progress’ on Peace Plan
item.description: Washington and Kyiv said that “highly productive” discussions over a proposal to end the war with Russia would continue. But details remained unclear.
